Reviews.Title: “Fine central location”
Reviews.Author: Langejan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel for 2 nights from saturday to monday in connection with a soccer match. Rooms are of a good size and looked clean. Bathroom is also sizeable and had a nice selection of accessories. Tv in room is small and there is not free wifi in the room. Some street noice but not in any way a nuisance. No noice from the other guests. Very nice view from 11th floor over the city. Small gym with 4 machines (one threadmill, two exercise bikes and a multimachine. Breakfast buffet had a good choice of mainly cold dishes. Limited selection of warm dishes.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the hotel very much!”
Reviews.Author: Tuomas H
Reviews.Content: Short walking distance to La Rambla annd nice restaurants nearby. Hotel very clean and rooms relatively big and got also free upgrade to better room when there was available. Breakfast was not the best one but was ok anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at handy location”
Reviews.Author: Bengikoksaloglu
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 4 nights in march. I left very happy. Hotel is not at very central to tourist attraction but 5 min to one of main central station, very each to reach from airport and with 5-10 min underground you are at whereever you would like in barcelona. Very clean, hotel staff speaks perfect english and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jbgtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Mobile World Congress and will definitely return. The hotel staff were friendly and most spoke English (or enough that the combination of our broken Spanish and their hesitant English worked). We lucked out and got a room with a huge deck overlooking the Rambla de Cataluyna. The only thing that would have made it better was having a table or some chairs out there. Otherwise, the rooms were clean and well taken care of. Do bring your own shampoo though - the one provided by the hotel got the job done but was a far cry from what I was used to. I'll echo the raves about their breakfast buffet. Tons of selections, with an international appeal (meats, cheeses, yogurts, fruit, etc.). The location was ideal. Within walking distance of a ton of restaurants, the main retail shopping street, and numerous metro stops, we only had to take a taxi once. Since I was there on business, it also gets high marks for fast wireless internet (although it's not free).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: Gretchen M
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband in May of 2011. Perfect hotel. Right in the heart of Las Ramblas! Perfect for walking around downtown. Great cafe on the corner. We ate there for breakfast three out of four mornings. The staff are very friendly and try to help english speaking guest as much as possible. Rooms are clean and nicely appointed. Ask for a high floor with a view of Las Ramblas. Only one con from our point of view: hotel buffet breakfast was quite expensive for the amount of offerings. We plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the best location in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: sigalit s
Reviews.Content: we had very good timein the hotel. the best location in Barcelona- on the Ramblas. clean rooms, good food, Hotel staff courteous and polite. Near the best taps restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Luaysaffar
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel,very clean rooms ,Modern furniture ,Good location ,Free internet only at the lobby which is not good. Every thing is near by the hotel,taxi stop ,shops ,coffee shop ,restaurants and Catalonia all by walk I strongly Recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Experience more than review.”
Reviews.Author: Mad-Milk
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days on circuit festival 2011. Hotel is neat, breakfast was ok and the roof top pool was great! We used the gym too. Every morning after breakfast we went on the pool for some sunbathing. After that we just walked away from the Rambla. Everyone local who asked where we stayed was pleased about the rambla where Calderon is located. They said that it's a secure rambla without hookers and pickpockets. So it's a "neat rambla" (Still be very cautious when moving anywhere in Barcelona. Try to blend in.) Nh Calderon is so close to subway and busses, that it was maybe the biggest ++. Circuit festival party places were not in city centre, so you have to be comfortable to use the mass transit. When we were not in the parties or Sitges or Marbella, we just walked to the "gay centre". Nh Calderon is not the cheapest hotel, but in my opinion its worth every penny! Next year we will go straight to Sitges and make day trips to Barcelona ;)

Reviews.Title: “NH Calderon”
Reviews.Author: Manuel S
Reviews.Content: Great location!! In the middle of everything and far enough from the noise. Walking distance to almost everywhere. Buses and subway just few blocks away, and easy to get from and to airport. The swimming pool is on the roof and has great views of Barcelona, too bad they close it around 8:30pm so you cannot enjoy a night view. Rooms are very decent and comfy. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A very good value”
Reviews.Author: claireibz
Reviews.Content: Great location and very good hotel. Clean, quiet and spacious room, amazing breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Carlic2311
Reviews.Content: Close to Place de Catalunya, you can walk to the monumental part of the town without need of public transports that however are noumerouses for longest run. Very kindly reception and good advices for your requests, excellent breakfast, quiet, good panorama is an excellent price per money visiting this nice town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Thordis P
Reviews.Content: Room facilities very good, spacious and comfortable. Great location, close to centre and good restaurants. However the fitness room was disaapointing. I expect to have access to a Treadmill when I choice a hotel with fitness centre, but the room was small with very limited facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: cokeguy72
Reviews.Content: A very nice and comfortable hotel in a safe neighborhood and only a 5-minute walk from Plaza Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The standard room we had was spacious by European standards; updated and comfortable; good linens, nice decor (queen bed, not king); the bathroom was quite large; the room furnishings nice and practical. There are lots of eating options on Rambla Catalunya, right outside the hotel door, and on Passeig de la Gracia, just a short block away. This is a nice hotel and the neighborhood is lovely, elegant and much quieter and calmer than Las Ramblas. The staff was helpful, friendly and very knowledgeable. The hotel is a favorite of folks on cruises so reserve ahead, if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not best value”
Reviews.Author: CanadianIslanders
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and the standard room we had was very updated and comfortable- good linens, nice decor (queen bed, not king). The room was an average size and the bathroom was quite large. We did have a problem with the bed being on wheels and the brake not working so when we sat up to read the bed kept sliding away from the headboard! We booked here because one night included as part of a cruise package so we decided to go a day earlier. It was in a good location and a five minute walk to Catalunya Square (the start of the Hop On Hop Off so very convenient). It is also walking distance from many of the sights including some of the Gaudi buildings. My biggest issue that while travelling extensively many, smaller boutique hotels include WIFI and often at least a small breakfast. At this chain hotel the WIFI was not free but they did give you 1/2 hour in the lobby - why wouldn't they just let you have it in the comfort of your room. Their lobby is not even that big. Their breakfast cost over EUR 20! We got it paid for the second day so we went but we thought it was over the top expensive and the food was fine but nothing exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfy room”
Reviews.Author: hemenp
Reviews.Content: Traveled here for business with my 15 year old in tow. I wanted a safe neighborhood, not too near to Las Ramblas, but close enough to be able to walk. This location was excellent. A 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas and a 10 minute walk to La Pedrera. The neighborhood was very safe and there were lots of eating options right outside the hotel. The breakfast was good and had plenty of variety. The room was spacious and the beds comfortable for European standards (not too hard). Reception was helpful as I needed a paper printed out for my conference and they did that for me at no extra charge (I also speak Spanish, but I did hear the staff at the desk speak English quite well). My one complaint was the 15 euro per day -charge for internet-- seriously? At a four star hotel? Overall, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: martris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within close distance to various modernist buildings, including the Pedrera, and also within walking distance (5-10 minutes) to Las Ramblas. The neighborhood is lovely, elegant and much calmer than Las Ramblas, with nice restaurants and stores. The staff at NH Calderón was helpful, friendly and knowledgeable about tourist sites and places to eat. The rooms were contemporary, clean, and had large bathrooms. The hotel's design is 1960s or 1970s modern, it seems, so does not have historic charm, but the location, rooms, and service make this a good choice to a stay in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel ~Great location”
Reviews.Author: mcogal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 years ago before a cruise and thought we would give it a try once again.The property is still well maintained and very clean. The location is fantastic.An easy to walk to Las Ramblas and city center. We got to the hotel pretty early and when we went to check in the gal told us our room would be ready at 3pm.Exhausted after being up all night on a trans atlantic flight we just sat in their lobby.She the called my husband back to the counter 10 minutes later to say they had a room with 2 twin beds ready if we wanted that instead of the large bed we reserved .My husband said fine.As we collected all of our belongings and made our way back to the desk a gentleman came to assist us. Would you believe HE had a room with a large bed for us in HIS computer!!!!!!!.She was not very pleasant .He on the other hand could not have been more friendly or helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Keggon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location for exploring the city, on a quiet street, but within walking distance of transport hubs. Breakfast is also exceptional, and forms a good basis for a day's sightseeing. Problems with the a/c stopped the rating from being 5.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break away from London”
Reviews.Author: M S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is extremely centrally located and is within walking distance of most Barcelona attractions. Right on the hotel doorstep are also quite a few street restaurants. The hotel is on Rambla Catalunya, not Las Ramblas. A common misunderstanding. Having said that. Rambla Catalunya is smaller, quieter and more intimate and hence my preferred location. The hotel has a lovely roof-top swimming pool with possibly some of the best views of the city all the way from Sagrada Familia to the harbour and to the hills. It's great for viewing the sunset as well. The gym in the hotel is very small and only comprises of a few pieces of equipment. If gym is your thing during your time away from home, this hotel probably isn't for you. I can't comment on the hotel restaurants as I was too busy exploring all the great food the city has to offer. I stayed in room 1039 which is a lovely extra large room with a king bed but there was a small issue with it. There is a strange smell in the room (you get used to it very quickly and only notice it the first minute or two when you enter) that the staff didn't manage to get rid of. I requested a room change but unfortunately the hotel was fully booked during my stay so the hotel offered me a generous discount. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. Had it not been for the smell factor, I would probably have given the hotel a 5 star rating for comfort. Finally, if you do rent a car, the hotel has an underground car park which is a great bonus in a city like Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpster
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our short stay at this simple business class hotel before our Barcelona cruise. The hotel is on a relatively quiet street, just a block or two from anything and everything you would ever want in the heart of Barcelona. The price we got through Orbitz was a steal for a price of this quality in such a great area. Everything about the hotel itself was very pleasant. Check-in went very smoothly and our room was ready even though we arrived before check-in time. The room, while small, was very modern and stylish, with unusual wood floors and excellent beds. The bathroom was very up-to-date. The only issue I had was figuring out how to operate the lights, but once the staff explained it, things were fine. The desk staff was both helpful and friendly, patiently answering several questions and offering help like providing adaptors so I could charge my Blackberry. All in all, this is a very nice place to stay if you want to be in a central location in a modern hotel charging a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: bling69
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel great location in shopping district. Good sized rooms great breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: susLA
Reviews.Content: Basic modern city hotel. Nothing luxurious or fancy, but adequate. Very convenient location. Great street for cafes and restaurants, near good shopping and several Gaudi sights, close to the metro and Ramblas. Room was modern, clean, comfortable, and fortunately not loud at all. There was an odd smell near the spacious bathroom but wasn't overly distracting. The breakfast buffet they offer is very good, but not sure it's worth the extra cost - I would suggest getting a cafe and croissant across the street or down the street and saving the $ for a delicious big lunch.

Reviews.Title: “NH Calderon, Barcelona, Spain”
Reviews.Author: ray g
Reviews.Content: room clean, small but adequate, quiet, comfortable bed, AC worked,excellent location,good accessories, breakfast buffet ridiculously overpriced by even NYC standards. Staff competent but distant. Pricey for location was selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Super place in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Tomitronic
Reviews.Content: The NH Calderon is a very nice hotel in the centre of Barcelona. It's located at the beginning of the northern stretch of the Rambla, just 200 meters north of Plaza Catalunya. There's a fair amount of eateries and cafés nearby, and a 7 minute walk from the Metro. Rooms are not the biggest in the world, but they are all practical, clean and really comfortable, with workspace, aircon, minibar and so forth. Everything works brilliantly. On the roof, there is an outdoor swimming pool plus some massage treatment, etc. - this is a really cool feature given that you're right in the center of the city. Even if it's not heated up, it's just wonderful to take a swim after long hours of batteling with the noise and troubles of Barcelona. Also, this hotel has its own parking facility in the basement, though it's a little tricky to find. Overall, the price/quality factor is great. Good, central, clean, nice staff. Only negative feedback I have is that car parking is very expensive (nobody really needs a car in central Barcelona anyway), and that they think that the WIFI cost for €15 per day is reasonable. Also, breakfast may be good - but for what they charge, you'd better eat somewhere else round the corner, saving you at least 80% on the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Location is convenient, quiet, and expensive and room was modern, comfortable, and large”
Reviews.Author: Epel
Reviews.Content: Hotel NH Calderon located within minutes walking from Pl Catalonia where you can catch tour buses, trains, and airport shuttle. Location is convenient, quiet, and expensive. Do not consider any hotels in old town, cathedral, or ramblas as they are crowded, dirty, and unpleasant at night. My wife and I were pleased our choice of NH Calderon hotel. Cheapest (what we booked) room was modern, comfortable, and large. Everything is brand new including convenient furniture. Hotel has a nice pool on the roof with a magnificent view. There are few sun beds by the pool side, sauna, and other spa features. Barcelona is HOT in September so the refreshing pool is excellent for a quick break during busy touring day. Breakfast was poor and overpriced and I do not recommend. Hotel provide free internet in lobby. It is slow but possible. At the checkout they charged or tried to charge us for some nuts from a mini-bar which we did not even see making us explain. That was unpleasant, humiliating, and stupid for the management, and really (I mean it) ruined the impression.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the NH Calderon”
Reviews.Author: malfredsen
Reviews.Content: We were very happy about our choice of hotel in Barcelona, although we would have liked even better if they had familyrooms. As a family of 4 we had to split into 2 rooms which of course is OK but not ideal. The rooms were beautiful! Very fresh and delicate with a wonderful bathroom. Very comfortable beds!! The location couldn`t have been any better, right on the Ramblas Catalunya with ceveral Tapas bars lined up right outside the front door (Yammee:)!) and just a couple of blocks from Las Ramblas. We loved the rooftop garden with a pool which we mostly had all to ourselves. The view from there was magnificent!! Breakfast was fabolous and gave us the perfect start to the day!! Would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but better can be found in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DonMacP
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights at the NH Caleron. The room was large as was the bathroom and nicely equiped and air conditioned and clean. Breakfast was fairly standard but one could eat well for much less at any number of places nearby which had more atmosphere. Lobbey leaves something to be desired..looks very 70"s. Free Internet access is limited to 15 minutes at one of 2 computers in the lobby. Best feature is the roof-top pool which has a nice view but unfortunately no service for drinks or food. Location is a plus..many good restaurants right outside on the mall including an excellent one right across the street. A short walk to the metro and 10 minute walk to the airport bus. Laundry service was excellent although pricy.

Reviews.Title: “Large great room, but not enough sunbeds”
Reviews.Author: Norwegian38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Calderon during Circuit Festival. Large and great room. Comfortable bed and great bathroom. Roof terrace with swimming pool had not many sunbeds. It was a shame, as it would be nice to be there on hot sunny days.

Reviews.Title: “Super, trendy rooms, nice swimmingpool and great buffet breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DasHans
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to stay for a longer periode. High value in service, buffet breakfast and rooms. Cleam, nice and comfortable. The hotel is justa walk towards the metro into town. But it has some great and cheap restaurants around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: shopn
Reviews.Content: very nice boutique hotel and one block off of Las Ramblas, which is good. Close to hop on hop off bus. Hotel is very clean and modern. Small rooms but for a short stay, just right. The bathroom is very nice and amenities are provided, which was a very nice touch. Te breakfast buffet for 20 euros was very pricey and was on the European style with cold cuts and cheese. Only hard boiled eggs, not much in the American fare to choose from. The hotel is a good value. Enjoy Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location. Fantastic value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ckaye1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just off Plaza de Catalunya so very central for sightseeing. We stayed on the first floor and were not disturbed by road noise at all. The room was spacious by European city standards with a nice bathroom and all fittings were modern and contemporary. Very clean in both the room and communal areas. Breakfast was superb, everything you would expect and many other interesting things I have never seen on a breakfast buffet before. And the rooftop pool is defenitely a bonus! At just over £100 a night this was fabulous value for money and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: RBNY65
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with the NH Calderon. The rooftop pool was amazing with spectacular views of the city. The room itself was very modern and well equipped with all amenities necessary for a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HugoColle
Reviews.Content: Value for money, friendly staff and clean hotel. Restaurant was very nice, bar where u can get drinks and snacks. Morning buffet was wonderful, what a choice ... Hotel is nearby the city center so perfect to get around and see the lovely things in Barcelona. Perfect, when i go back to Barcelona i will stay here again..

Reviews.Title: “Great location and yummy breakast”
Reviews.Author: Camilla2011
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Barcelona on business this hotel is a perfect choice. The location (the beginning og Rambla de Catalunya) is ideal for putting on your walking shoes on and explore the city on foot. Easy access to everything. Rambla de Catalunya is the "nicer" Rambla - I am in Barcelona regularly and don't like the original Rambla that much, with tourist and people trying to sell you all sorts of stuff and the restaurants ripping you off. Oh well.. back to the hotel! NH Calderon is a classic business/leisure hotel with nice interior in dark wood and no carpets! which I like, very Scandinavian. NH Calderon has a nice pool area where you can enjoy the view of the city and work on your tan. But come early! it's a very small area and always full of course, but if you find a spot you forget that you in a big city. I saved the best for last! The breakfast. It was really really good. It's a buffet which I sometimes find not very charming. But the staff and cooks at NH Calderon makes the buffet really great, it has everything you need and I have never seen a bigger breakfast selection of cakes (I like) I would absolutely recommend this hotel if it's your first time in Barcelona or just likes it nice and organized. if you want a true Spanish experience, then you should find another place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to stay!”
Reviews.Author: nikolyo
Reviews.Content: Basically with its location, it was a really nice place to stay. The rooms are nice decorated, big enough and clean. The breakfast was really good. We loved it. Another plus was for the reception that all the restaurants they recommended us were really good. So they didn't disappoint us in anyway.

Reviews.Title: “great location..great rooftop pool and view for a bit of r and r..”
Reviews.Author: cdag
Reviews.Content: family of 4 stayed in two rooms. we were able to book the non refundable rate so got a pretty good deal. Great location. Could walk to Las Ramblas, but very near the Passa De Gracia (I think) street which is lovely. Many great cafe's across from the hotel..the rooms are very large, with sitting rooms and great bathrooms. loved it and would most certainly stay here again. Lobby was quite busy upon check in..early check in doesnt appear to be an option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadridClydo
Reviews.Content: Great location, very quiet rooms, comfortable beds. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Clean Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bahey
Reviews.Content: - Perfect location - Clean Stay - Acceptable Pool on roof for a change - Breakfast good - Perfect stay for business as well as leisure that need above average place to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel , beside everthing”
Reviews.Author: Rainydaysinireland
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable , but bar staff were hard to find and the bar was empty of drinks

Reviews.Title: “good location - good food - good everything”
Reviews.Author: kawaiiqueen
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my second stay in this hotel. Rooms are spacious, clean, modern and very well equipped. There is an extra door between the entrance door and the room, this guarantees you a good and silent sleep. Breakfast is excellent, with fresh and quality food mixed with spanish specialities. they have fantastic nespresso coffee machine in the breakfast room,so you can prepare you your coffee as you like. I have tried the restaurant. and this was a great surprise too. For only 25 euros I had a fanstastic 3 course gourmet menu with wine and water included. I know that Barcelona has a great restaurant offer, but this restaurant worth all the money I have spent. I will recommend this hotel and this restaurant to everyone. Best accommodation in Barcelona for price, quality and location. They also have a sport center and a sauna and a pool, but I did not use them..

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous place/location”
Reviews.Author: Joris064
Reviews.Content: This nice hotel is just off the place the Catalunya in City center on the Rambla. Easy access to the Metro, close to the old city. The rooms are beautiful albeit dimly lit. Service is great.. You do pay a pretty penny for parking and internet access. However, convenience comes at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Giuliov81
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, perfect location, nice rooms, nice swimming pool on the roof with beautiful view of the city, really good buffet for breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Sjblade
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and we were anxious about what we would get. NH Calderon turned out to be the perfect hotel for us! Our first impression was superb. We arrived at the hotel at about 9 AM after a red-eye flight from USA. The morning was rainy and cold and the staff allowed us to check in early-we were so relieved. The location is EXCELLENT! It is so close to everything. The rooms were very modern and stylish, though a bit on the small size. The beds were slightly uncomfortable but we found that all the hotels we stayed in Spain were as well. The staff was always friendly and willing to assist. The hotel has internet and gives 30 minute complimentary internet service, however it is questionable whether you really get your full 30 minutes. After that you can use a credit card however beware--it adds up and adds up quickly! All in all, a great hotel in an excellent location with a great value!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, clean hotel!”
Reviews.Author: guf57
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, clean hotel. Staff was very polite and helpful. Room was very clean and modern. It was very quiet and close to many attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Hazel23
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. It's beautiful, modern, large rooms and bathrooms tastefully decorated. Great breakfast. Lovely pool on the roof. The boys used the pool and the sauna and really enjoyed it. The location is first class, right on the Ramblas de Catalunya. The only downside was the staff on the front dest - totally unhelpful and unfriendly. But you can ignore this and enjoy the rest.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION.....BUT DISAPPOINTING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: DALDEV
Reviews.Content: After reading all the great reviews prior, we were let down as to the quality of room. Booked a superior room which was large, no complaints here but room needed redecorating. Everything looked tired, sofa and chair in room had stains on it. Even one of the larger scatter cushions was yellowing from oldness. No flat screen TV and the aircondioning worked but super efficient. We had no problems with staff all spoke reasonable english. One guy gave us a hot tip to go to the tapas bar next door (50m away). Fantastic, great food always buzzing with people. We travelled Europe for 4 weeks and this hotel let us down, at least Barcelona city was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Excellent Room”
Reviews.Author: Bridget63
Reviews.Content: We Priceline'd this hotel at $120. It was a bargain for sure. This hotel was super clean. Beds were comfy. Bathroom was well appointed Plenty of restaurants nearby, easy walk anywhere. Room service menu was reasonable, if limited Cabs are right on the corner, if you need to go somewhere fast Hint: Don't count on English speaking front desk personnel...they are limited, but we managed to get by.

Reviews.Title: “ITS PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: DebbeChristy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, modern and very central. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooftop pool was amazing. The gym was missing a treadmill though, perhaps in for repairs? Otherwise, this will definitely be my hotel of choice in future visits to Barcelona. Walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect oasis after a 23 hour flight!”
Reviews.Author: vegasscot
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights in the NH Calderon in Barcelona in September of 2010, and I cannot wait to return. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk of the Casa Battlo and the metro station. On the street in front of the hotel is a perfect array of dining options for any time of day. The room was excellent, very clean, and filled with all the things that I needed as an American woman away from home. The staff was marvelous. Everybody spoke beautifully in English, even when I tried to speak to them in Spanish. And, one night when I was in the lobby around 3am trying to talk on Skype to my young children back home in the US, the desk clerk gave me some extra internet time and told me to move my laptop into a different location for the best signal. I would stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “DA NON PERDERE”
Reviews.Author: Pippola
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Calderon for 6 days during august 2010. The Hotel is very well situated over Rambla de Catalunya with plenty of tapas bars , restaurants and whatever you want in few meters. Plaza de Catalunya , the heart of the city in 2 minutes walking. The room, junior suite, was very spacious and well equipped, maybe the bathroom would be more spacious, but architects are architects. We had a little terrasse in common with the next room whit all the aircon motors, obviously never used, and a balcony over rambla de catalunya, nice to see the city life, but no chair on the balcony and the doors were too small to bring a chair from the room. Comfy beds and a very clean room, a cleanliness I never seen before in a hotel, no matter the stars it had. nice aircon you could control as you needed. Nice staff, women, a little bit rude, men. We dind't have breakfast at the hotel, too expensive for our habits, but there were Ciutat Comtal, very close were you coud have a great breakfast for 3 euros. All in all, as I go to barcellona quite every year I'll go back to Calderon, and recommend it to everybody because it worth the price which is not so high.

Reviews.Title: “just great”
Reviews.Author: donaldgregoryBelfast
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal inc breakfast so stayed for four days. We meant to go somewhere else for our remaining five days but decided to stay at Calderon again. Rooms great size with everything you could need. The breakfast is expensive if not part of your package-the orange juice is fresh and some items cooked from fresh if requested. Free internet for 15 mins per day. View from roof pool superb. Great location. Staff very friendly and professional

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: user2357
Reviews.Content: Great spot, utterly quiet a/c, fantastic breakfast. Absolutely clean room and maintained that way for the whole stay, although we really did our best to mess things up. The safe is big enough for a laptop (!) and two cameras. If you're lucky you can get the wifi from the hotel next door - it's free. worked fine for us.Would absolutely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice, modern room!”
Reviews.Author: jlrva
Reviews.Content: Our room was really nice. We booked on priceline and I was a little nervous they wouldn't honor our reservation but everything worked out ok and we got a good price. We arrived in Barcelona around 9 am and got to the hotel hours before check in. We went to the hotel first to see if we could check in early but they were not ready yet. They have a huge closet where they let us store our bags so we could sight see without our luggage until check in time. We were exhausted and only stayed one night before our cruise left the next morning, so we did not check out any of the amenities the hotel had. The room was very clean, looked brand new and very modern. We had a sliding glass door that opened onto a huge balcony. In the middle of the night we discovered the balcony was open to all when a ton of people were out there talking. It didnt last long though. The curtains really blocked out all the sunlight well in the morning and we slept very late (accidentally!). The location was fantastic, we walked to Las Ramblas which is right near the hotel. We also walked all the way to Sagrada Familia and Park Guell from the hotel, which I would not recomend. Its do-able but it was a very LONG hot walk, which took a long time, and we went through some areas of town I was not quite certain about. I thinkt here is a metro station close to the hotel so you could easily take that instead. We were just being cheap! They had free wireless internet in the room that worked well. Overall a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: carla12345
Reviews.Content: My parents came yesterday (25 May) from Barcelona and can not remember to have stayed in a hotel with such poor quality as yours. They arrived on 20 May to Barceloma and until his departure there was no change of linen or towels. Unfortunate gentlemen! The towels throughout the day not dried up what happened when they went back to clean up were wet! I will describe this situation in the various sites that give information to travelers about the quality of hotels, Trip Advisor and so on ... . Travelers should realize that a four-star hotel is nowhere near nowhere near a hotel with the minimum quality required. Sorry for the amount spent in this hotel! Beyond this point the hotel staff are very unfriendly always trying not to give much explanation or gently offering his services!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: adlaver
Reviews.Content: As many other reviewers have touched on, this is a good hotel to stay in with a great location. Yes, the beds we were in rolled a bit and had trouble keeping them together (2 twin beds pushed together), but still comfortable and served their purpose. Nice sized room with flat screen TV (minimal english TV, though) with mini bar, safe, large closets, nice, large & clean bathroom, etc. Interior door can close to shut out noise, but not an issue for us during our stay. Did not try the restaurant or breakfast (12 euro+/pp), but plenty to see and do and eat within walking distance of hotel. Metro stop also close by and extremely easy to navigate and use. Staff helpful at times, but not sure if there was a language or cultural barrier at times which made it a bit harder to communicate (in English) at times. Did not use room WiFi, but used the computers in the hotel lobby. Charge approx 2 euro per minute of use, but they were kinda slow which was frustrating when paying by time usage. All in all, though, would recommend this hotel based on the location, value and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad hotel but if you get your wallet stolen ....”
Reviews.Author: RSM28
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel but after leaving my wallet with no money or credit cards inside the room the whole experience has been destroyed as I got my wallet stolen from my room. It had no money or cards but had all my documents which will now be a pain to recover. What rate deserves a hotel where something like this happens??? Hoteliers should be more concerned about this especially a chain like NH .... I will never go back. Also, in case of this happening please have a response prepared apart from : hmmm pues no lo se (I don't know).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice choice”
Reviews.Author: lamberse
Reviews.Content: The location is great, close to everything! We enjoyed very much to stay there. Mostly because we got a good price on the weekend. The room was very nice and no street noise at all. The only negative thing was the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for business, solid hotel - recommend to have a look.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy F
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in room 212 (or 221), a corner room in February 2010 for Mobile World Congress. The stay was pleasant for my colleagues and me, and I wouldn't hesitate to look into this hotel on business or pleasure, as the location is great and the surroundings are excellent. As usual with my reviews, the Good, Bad, and Ugly. The Good - Room. It was a corner room next to the elevator bay - which I typically don't like because of the added noise. However, the room included a second interior door that kept out all outside noise (if there was any). In addition, the room was of good size and had some nice amenities: large closet, safe, combo tub/shower, working desk, hardwood floors, etc. (See note below under "Bad" concerning bed). - Cleanliness. Hats off to the cleaning staff. My room was spotless. - The windows must have been double paned because even though I was on the second floor, I could not hear much traffic. Yes, the occasion horn honking but nothing horrible. - Location. Close to underground (2 blocks) and relatively in the heart of the city. One night we ate at the waterfront and walked back to the hotel. It took about 30 minutes, but the walk was nice and we got to see a bit of the city. - A tip. Next door to the hotel (go left as exiting the property) on the corner is an absolutely excellent tapas bar. Do yourself a favor and either grab a table or sit at the bar. The barstaff and food was outstanding. What made it even better is that clearly the restaurant appeared to be more of a local haunt that a touristy spot. - Doorman. Helped me with my bags and offered to grab me a taxi, recommend spots, etc. Nice job. The Bad - The beds. Two major issues. First, the bed moved. I believe it was on wheels and would roll just a bit. Kinda of odd. Second, the bed was too soft and almost uncomfortable. I slept OK, but the bed was not up to par from what I would expect from a NH property. - Staff at check-in/check-out. Maybe it's the local culture, but neither was I greeted properly or thanked when I left the property. I understand it's a hectic week most likely, but at least look me in the eye instead of chatting with your co-workers (I was the only customer present at check out.) The Ugly - Charging a high amount (24 Euroish for 24 hours) for spotty wireless broadband access. Pathetic. I don't mind paying - but at least give your guests high speed access. Don't like this review - don't outsource your wifi service. With the mix of a nice room (questionable bed) and location, I would look into the property again. Enjoy Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “super choice hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: frah
Reviews.Content: stayed here over new year and could find very little negatives really. front desk very helpful.initially allocated us room508 as we requested a nice view perhaps she had a sense of humour as the view was a brick wall almost within touching distance. however went straight and it was instantly changed to a much better one with all the view you could want. room adequate in size,you can upgrade for 25 euro per night if you want. bathroom spotless and plenty large. cleaning was excellent. the breakfast(we were b&b)was superb ,everything you could wish for,cooked on request if asked for. one of the best we have enjoyed anywhere. in fact an english couple enjoyed it so much they filled a bag every morning,maybe they were opening a food stall somewhere. service here was excellent, nothing too much trouble. meant to try the restaurant-26euro pp but were having too much fun in the many tapas bars all around a word of advice drink wine as vodka and coke cost £8 per go,house wine only £10 a bottle. there is a 24 hour sandwich bar just down from the hotel where its half that price we would select this hotel for all the above plus it is only 5 min walk from placa catalunya where the airport bus drops off and picks up,5euro approx each way

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SomnathS
Reviews.Content: My frnd suggested we stay in NH Cal. this hotel is centrally located in Barcelona and frequently used by tourist. Rooms are nice and has the resto serves hot breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but there's better out there”
Reviews.Author: BowBell
Reviews.Content: Reading all of the other glowing reviews on this hotel, I feel that I must be a bit fussy! Nevertheless, I would not consider staying at this hotel again - YES, the location is fabulous - a short walk to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas, so perfect for all of the major tourist attractions or numerous restaurants & bars if you are in town on business. The hotel rooms are also very clean and modern, you could not really fault them from that perspective. However the beds were really uncomfortable, with bouncy mattresses and very poor quality pillows, so much so that neither of us really slept for our 3 night stay. The rooms are also small. The major disappointment are the public areas, particularly the bar - its dated and lacks any atmosphere whatsoever, The breakfast room was equally lacking and the buffet an expensive disappointment - don't bother! HOW

Reviews.Title: “A stunning 4* hotel”
Reviews.Author: LONDON009
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel and thought its one of the best 4* hotels we have been to in a long time. The location is great - close by las ramblas, Placa Catalunya and also there are bars/restaurants close by. The service is great - staff were really friendly. Loved the room - we were staying in a large suit. i would definitely stay at this hotel again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Poor value and service”
Reviews.Author: JROE
Reviews.Content: I din't like this hotel at all. Rooms were small as are all in Barcelona and decor was new and modern. Thats the only good thing I can say In the room the lighting was poor so it was hard to read, the AC didn't keep the room cool at all and in the shower the temperature changed. My biggest compliment was the front desk. They were not friendly nor helpful. Aslo there was a charge for WIFI and there was a free 15 minutes on the internet in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - just great”
Reviews.Author: yogimo
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this hotel. It is really good. At the check in booked the EUR 25 per night upgrade to deluxe room, that was the right thing to do. The living room with couch and TV is quite small, but still good, bathroom is large, although no separate shower, but I did not miss it. Bed room is gib enough, bed is comfortable. Electric plugs are next to the bed. The only minor is that WLAN costs 17 or 20 EUR a day, provided through Swisscom. Watch out for unprotected hotspots, so surfing can be free of charge... Breakfast is good, nice choices. Frontoffice staff is friendly and helpful. Watch out for the little tapas places close to the hotel - great food, especially if you do not want to wait until 8 pm to get something between your teeth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: VinoGal
Reviews.Content: The NH Calderon is a beautiful hotel and the front desk managers are very nice. Very comfortable beds! The only two drawbacks were the noise from the street and the lack of the AC or at least a fan to move around the air. (The AC worked but barely) The rooms were a bit stuffy and opening the windows was not an option since the noise from the streets was very loud. I would stay here again but ask for an interior room.

Reviews.Title: “We made a good choice here....”
Reviews.Author: PeteWM
Reviews.Content: We last stayed at this hotel 5 years ago, to start off a cruise. This time, we'd just disembarked the Oosterdam and wanted to see some more of Barcelona (our favourite city) so had booked to stay here for a couple of nights before our flight home. Both my wife and I are of the opinion that the hotel is much better than it was 5 years ago. The rooms are modern and very clean. The reception desk, although a little bit formal, were very helpful: we arrived very early, but were able to check in straight away; and we had a late flight so they allowed us to keep the room a little bit later, and then stored our luggage for us between checking out and getting a taxi to the airport. The breakfast was extensive and very nicely presented. The waiting staff are unobtrusive but very quick to assist when needed, and they are always busy tidying and cleaning tables and making sure the food is neatly arranged and presented correctly. We were very impressed! The rooftop pool's a bit small and there aren't many loungers, but it's o/k; and lets face it, who spends much time there anyway? We spent maybe an hour up there: you get some good views! The location is in my view excellent. Close to everything you want, restaurants; las Ramblas; the tour buses; Casa Batllo and la Pedrera; etc, and yet just far enough away so that it feels like a much quieter neighbourhood. We will stay here again, without doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Iluvcyprus_7
Reviews.Content: Was our first time in Barcelona but couldn't have picked a better hotel, we got the bus from the airport and the hotel was only a short walk from the square,on arrival we were upgraded to a suite on the 7th Floor which had it's own balcony with the most amazing views of the city. Staff were reall friendly and helpful and location was ideal, even down to the Harbour was only about a 20 min stroll. Rooftop pool was lovely for relaxing and catching some sun. Will definately return to Barcelona and this hotel. Just one word of warning the hotel is in a 'smart' area and nearby resteraunts and bars can be pricey (23 euros for 2 large beers)! If you are eating out there are some wonderful places on the backstreets of La Ramblas and Ferran (18 euros for 2 with wine). I would also recommend the 'red bus tour' from the suare if want a whistle stop tour of the main attractions- Park Guell is a must!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is fine, service could be way better!”
Reviews.Author: CarlaFreitas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 1 night during a weekend in September. Arrived at 3 pm and was told by the receptionist that my reservation did not exist, after she checked 2 or 3 computers (it wasn't supposed to be a central system?). I made the reservation the day before through a 3rd party company, however it was supposed to be an instant confirmation reservation! They took note of my credit card details and let us go to the rooms. The rooms are really small, however comfortable for such a short stay. They have LCD TV, comfy beds, bath tub with a good pressure, shampoo, shower gel and hair dryer. However make sure you close your room door properly, because it does not close automatically as it does in most hotels' rooms. The room is relatively good soundproofed, hardly heard any street noise however could heard flushing noise and banging doors from next rooms. Wifi Internet is 9€ a day. They also provide parking at 24€ per day, which is a good rate because all the parking spots in the city cost the same: 2,65€/hour. However having a car in Barcelona is definately not needed as it is a nightmare to find places to park! Also the hotel has a fantastic terrace on 11th floor with a good size swimming pool and a few loungers. Pool towers are provided for free. Make sure you go there for amazing city views! My rate was supposed to include breakfast, however when we got to the breakfast room we were told that our rate only included 1 breakfast per room, and that we would need to pay extra 20€ per person?!? I think the way this case was handled was not acceptable because a simple call to the reception would have solved the problem, however we had to go downstairs to solve the problem ourselves! They called the breakfast room and it took 15 minutes from the moment we got out of our rooms to be seated at the breakfast room! The breakfast itself is very good and they also make cook to order some selection of hot choices. So, make sure you make your reservation with days in advance to avoid having problems, and you'll be fine with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location, amazing roof top view of city”
Reviews.Author: jensatravellin
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for one evening. We originally booked a room and indicated that we had our young daughter with us but when we got our room there was only one bed. I went down to the front desk and told them, they acknowledged the mistake and gave me an upgrade to a jr. suite with no problems. The room we were originally given was nice and the new room was even nicer What a fantastic room! Seperate living room and bedroom. The living room had a pullout sofa bed, which was fine for daughter and the master bedroom was a very large room. The rooms are very modern and decorated very nicely. I'm quite picky with cleanliness and i couldn't find anything wrong with the room. Very clean, spacious and nice views. The hotel is located 10 min walk to Ramblas. The rooftop pool is very cool. Actually, the pool is ok but the views are awesome! We got some great pics from up there. Can't think of anything negative to say about the hotel, we really enjoyed our stay would certainly stay again if in Barcelona. Oh yeah, beds were super comfy.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL IN THE HEART OF THE CITY!!! 10/10”
Reviews.Author: rowdy102
Reviews.Content: We had the best time in this perfectly located hotel right in the heart of the city. Our room was on the 9th floor which I highly recommend because you get spectacular views over the city, it's like sitting in a panoramic postcard-view! there is a swimming-pool and sun-deck and spa and ftitness on the 11th floor, which is very rare for city-hotels in Barcelona and an amzing plus for this hotel, on top of that you get an overall panoramic stunning view from the sun-deck! the hotel is one of the biggest in Barcelona, but nevertheless with a cozy and warm feeling to it, the rooms are spacious, nicely decorated, modern but warm, with lots of comfort, lots of space for clothes and luggage in the entrance, a comfortable and big bathroom with all the necessary comfort. I found the staff very friendly, from the door-men, to the receptionists and the people in the breakfast-room, and the room-maids are also very kind and friendly, even if you wake up late in the afternoon they will still greet you with a smile before they make your room, which is very rare. The elevators are very fast and there is 5 of them, so there is never long waiting to get to your room on the top floors. The breakfast -buffet features everything you might wanna ask for, from the usual fresh orange juice to croissants, all kinds of cheese, bred, meat, eggs, yoghurt, cakes, sausages, fresh fruit, cereals, ....... Alltogehter we had the best time there and would definetely recommend this hotel, as much for groups of friends, as for couples or families or business people, everybody will feel comfortable there. For us it was the perfect choice and I will definetely try other NH Hotels in the world!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: route61revisited
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Barcelona and couldnt be more satisfied with the hotel. The location was amazing. The hotel was very clean, sober and comfortable. We stayed on the 1st floor with an amazing balcony just for us. The rooms were also very good, and the top roof poll with a fantastic view over Barcelona was simply out of this world! The only problem was the lack of space in the areas surronding the pool. We were tottaly happy with our choice and next time in Barcelona nh calderon will be the place to stay. Totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for weekend break”
Reviews.Author: SouthAfricanNomad
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was amazing. The staff didn't bother us while we were eating. The room was very comfortable - a quiet haven away from the bustle of Barcalona. The pool and the gym were both a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michoupitchou
Reviews.Content: Wonderful 4* hotel. Swimming pool on the rooftop, very nice room, friendly staff. Quite expensive, but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: catwalk_76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in walking distance to many attractive places like gaudi houses, sagrada familia, las ramblas, passeig de gracia,plaza catalunya etc. very close to metro station. Tehe environment is safe. There are several good cafes and restaurants near the hotel. The rooms are very clean and big enough. I highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and great rooftop pool”
Reviews.Author: Losviages
Reviews.Content: NH Calderon is one of my favourite hotels in BCN for its excellent location (you can't get more central than this), comfortable rooms + the spacious rooftop pool and sun deck. The hotel lobby is slightly dark and has a bit old-fashioned, pompous feel with all the green marble and everything, but the rooms are very modern instead. We had booked our room on one day notice and were accomodated to one of the smaller rooms that have only a small window. Nevertheless, there was just the space needed for our luggage and I didn't mind so much about the relative dimness of the room either. Our bathroom had a walk-in shower instead of a bathtub, which was great, and was perfectly clean. Our bed was also incredibly comfortable and overall I found the room very cozy. The rooftop pool is fantastic and offers a great view over the neighbouring buildings. I can certainly recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly if you manage to get a nice offer for the room, the hotel is quite pricey after all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal, Room and Location”
Reviews.Author: markicof
Reviews.Content: The hotel was offering a very good deal for weekend rates on 'Club' rooms which includes breakfast . If you can while checking in / booking request room 703. It was the room we got with a stunning balcony on the Rambla Catalunya and I think the only one on that side. The only negative things I have to say about this hotel is the check in is at 3pm (although they will hold your luggage for you) and that it is a little 'buisness' for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gess0011
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a long, solo weekend in Barcelona (3 days). I was traveling alone, and had never been to Barcelona, so I wanted a nice, clean, safe hotel within walking distance of shopping, restaurants, sight-seeing, etc...and this hotel was PERFECT. The hotel was recently rennovated and is beautiful (very modern, like any nice hotel I would find back home in the U.S.). The room was very clean and spacious. The location was perfect, an it only cost about 7 euros to get from the train station to the hotel. From the hotel, I could easily walk to tons of bars and al of the major shopping locations, plus, since it was only 2 blocks from the plaza catalunya, I could easily catch the Barcelona Bus Touristic (tour bus) to get to any major tourist spot in the city (Park Guell, Segrada Familia, Olympic Stadium, the beach, etc). The breakfast buffet was great, but I would not reccommend eating lunch or dinner in the hotel (there were better, cheaper options at the restaurants and cafes right outside the hotel). Overall, I had a wonderful trip. I will definitely return to Barcelona, and I will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: scotrompol
Reviews.Content: Check-in was smooth and without a problem. Staff were very helpful - esp Jorge at the front desk. Porters didn't hang around for a tip (although I did obige!). Room was well appointed although could have done with a light in the wardrobes as they are quite dark and there wasn't much natural light in the room we were allocated (not a big deal as the view was good). Wooden laminate floors in the bedroom - gave a sense of cleanliness but cold on the feet (I guess it shows that you expect the same as what you have at home). Breakfast was good but could do with additional coffee makers - there were always queues in front of the only one and staff tried to appease the end of the queue by asking if you would prefer an instant coffee from the kitchen. This hotel helped make our stay in Barcelona very memorable for all the right reasons.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel for a visit to Barcelona (returning guest)”
Reviews.Author: Mistaya71
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the NH Calderón 9 years ago for business and have since returned four times for leisure. The location is superb: away from the main drag but only a few hundred yards from the Plaça Catalunya (point to get off/on the Aerobus) so most tourist attractions (Barri Gotic/Ramblas/Gaudi houses) are within easy walking distance. More importantly the best tapas restaurant in town (Ciudad Condal) or possibly of the country even is just a few steps away on the other corner of the block. Needless to say we have never tried the hotel's restaurant (Ciudad Condal is excellent for breakfasts too! And for lunch, and for dinner, and for in between snackies,...). The swimming pool on top of the building, although small, is a very welcome point of rest after strolling through the city on a warm day and has a superb view of the city. They could do with more sunbeds though, there never seems to be enough. There used to be a small indoor swimming pool as well on the ground floor but unfortunately it's no longer in use. The rooms (both standard and superior) are fabulous: very clean and modern. The room has a flat screen tv with several foreign channels (German, French, BBC) in addition to the standard Spanish channels. The bathroom is well appointed and clean. It used to be stocked with plenty of toiletries including razor and comb. For some reason this has been stopped and so we had to go out and buy a comb and razor during our last stay... The minibar is expensive (but not outrageously), the safety box is free. The only negative point I can think of is the airconditioning. During our last stay (early March) the inside temperature in the room was higher than the outside temperature and we couldn't get the airconditioning to work on full (winter setting). Sleeping with the window open is not an option because of the noise (especially on a Saturday night). Not all staff are fluent in English but they do try. Greeting them in Spanish usually breaks the ice! They will also keep your luggage safely stored on the day of your flight home so you don't have to lug it around before your return to the airport. Don't be put off by the security men in the lobby either: they are very much on the ball and actually make you feel safe. Another nice touch is the computers you can use in the lobby. On request you are given a free voucher (one per day) which will give you EUR 5 worth of internet use / page printing. Enough to do the OLCI for your flight home and check your email. There is a taxi stand right in front of the hotel. Excellent for your trip to Parc Güell (or wherever you want to go). The taxidrivers are very friendly and helpful, and the prices more than reasonable. A few years ago we had booked a room at another hotel but changed it back to the Calderón at the very last minute: it really is the best hotel for what we want and excellent quality for value so why change a winner?!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel with beautiful views of the city and mountains”
Reviews.Author: m0welsh
Reviews.Content: Great location on the quieter side of the La Rambla! Within walking distance to many of the attractions of the La Rambla, cathedrals, shopping, bus tours, the Marina and the wonderful La Boquera marketplace! A fun city to explore and or just sit and have a glass of wine out on the La Rambla and people watch. The hotel was clean and well appointed. Clean (masculine lines - my husband loved it) Flat screen tv, clean bathroom with great bidet, nice mini bar and open closet to store your suitcase...see pictures. The staff was friendly and most usually spoke enough English to communicate. The food at the restaurant was great but a bit pricey. Free internet in the lobby for 15 minutes each day of stay. Gorgeous views from your room and on the rooftop pool area. It helps to have a pocket translator (purchased from Borders Books back in USA...$15.00 for 5 language..Eng, Spainish, French, German and Italian).

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the city”
Reviews.Author: Sat_44
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location near the Ramblas and the Catalunya square. At the same time it's not in a crowded area so you can sleep at night. I was in a superior room I believe (or else they have really incredible standard rooms), for which I didn't pay the supplement, as I'm an employee of the chain. It was spacious, well furnished and modern. bathroom was great with a separate area for sink/wardrobe and toilet/bath. We didn't had much of a view but it was not annoying as we were always outside. The pool on the roof is great. Staff was helpfull and friendly except one girl who really needed to review her guest service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Barca”
Reviews.Author: joeysoap
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel in early April. Online booking and requested - early check in, high floor (on the grounds that if there are views you might as well enjoy them) and non smoking. Arrived around 12 noon and met with friendly check in staff. all requests supplied. Room was above average with nicely divided bathroom. Free safe and honour minibar. Breakfast was excellent with a greater choice of fruits/breads than most hotels. Hot breakfast was available on request. Bar was nice and relaxing after a lot of sightseeing before heading out again at night, but maybe a little too quiet for some. Didn't eat in the hotel at night as nobody ever appeared to be in the restaurant. Weather wasn't warm enough for rooftop pool. All staff always had a greeting no matter where they met you and particularly the breakfast room staff. ( breakfast was served until 11am which was another plus) Barcelona itself was everything one could wish for with lots to do and see. However eating out was something of a chore. Most restaurants closed down from 4 until around 8.30/9pm. This didn't really suit our plans/way of eating etc. And when they did open the (presumably) better ones filled up immediately. Food was indifferent and not cheap but then again it is a major city and probably no worse than most others. As for tapas bar , if I never seen another one ..........

Reviews.Title: “expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: good hotel 3-4 stars price is high in comparison with others you can get more for less at crystal or onix just near by excellent breakfast clean but nothing special room very well located near plaza cataluña

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Great Locations”
Reviews.Author: Mr Melv
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the NH Calderon with my family for the half term break. I had stayed in NH chain hotels elsewhere on business and had always been impressed and the Calderon did not disappoint. We had two twin rooms, next to each other at the end of a corridor which was ideal for us with our two boys. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but not to the point of being a problem, and were very nicely appointed. Bathroom facilities were particularly good. The key feature, however, was the location. Just a few hundred yards from the Placa Catalunya and the top of the Ramblas, but far enough away from the Ramblas to be quiet and safe. Lots of nearby Tapas Bars and restaurants, and local shops. However avoid La Raca restaurant across the road from the hotel - they just open packets and heat them in the microwave - we realised just in time to abort a meal there. Excellent coffee and breakfast at the Comtal Cuitat at the corner of Rambla Catalunya just yards from the hotel. Happy Grill at Placa Catalunya was great for a family meal. Staff at the Calderon were very pleasant and helpful. We didn't try the food in the hotel given the local amenities. The only problem with the hotel was the risk of noise from neighbouring rooms. The walls are paper thin and the you can hear the TVs and conversations from neighbouring rooms (this was ideal for us to know whether the boys next door were behaving!). The wooden floors add to the noise. Over a five day stay we only had one problem when out neighbours came in at 2 a.m. and started talking - waking us up. So it is a bit pot luck whether you are next to quiet guests or not. We will stay at the Calderon again next time we visit Barcelona, simply due to the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: TiniNewYork
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a 4 night trip. Incredibly disappointed and shocked to find good reviews about the same hotel I had stayed in. The only positive about the hotel is its location. It is a few blocks from Las Ramblas and close to other popular spots. We were able to walk to the Sagrada familia, the Cathedral and Museu Picasso from there, approximately 20 minutes. Also close to the metro. There is a bus for about 3.75 from the airport that stops in front of the hotel; one of my coworkers took it, approximately 30 minutes by taxi. Taxi is about 30 bucks each and that includes an airport surcharge. Hotel room is very small, two twin beds make up a double room. I was a literally a few inches from my coworker. There wasn't much room to walk around. We were on the third floor. Our other coworkers were on the 6th, and that room was much larger(same twin beds) Room was extremely hot during the day even after someone looked at it. When we complained at the desk we were told that we weren’t in America and the air conditioning isn’t the same, even though the lobby’s temperature was acceptable. Almost every person at the front desk was rude and unfriendly. They never looked up, never smiled, and never greeted you. I’ve never experienced anything like it, was very surprised. When the front desk clerk heard me speak Spanish after a short conversation we had in English, I was admonished because I didn’t speak my pathetic Spanish first. This type of behavior does effect your mood even if you are trying to make the best out of it. Phone message system does not work. They left us a written message underneath our door, hours after the phone call. WORST OF ALL, THE HOTEL’S COFFEE WAS TERRIBLE, YUK. Breakfast selections were decent. Walk to any coffee shop/restaurant in the area and you’ll be extremely satisfied with the coffee. Barcelona is very beautiful and defiantly worth a visit. Good customer service will not be found here, there has to be better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!!!”
Reviews.Author: brooke16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Calderon for 2 nights a few weeks ago and was very happy with the hotel. We had a room on the 10th floor with an excellent view of all of Barcelona. The room was decorated nicely with dark wood and mirrors. The front desk was pleasant and helpful and the lobby was very pretty and modern. The pool on the top floor has excellent views of Barcelona as well , although we did not swim. The location is great a 7 minute walk to las ramblas and is right next to Placa de Cataluna which has many restaurants and lots of action. When I was in Spain 2 years previously I had friends staying here and they loved it then so i took their advice , tried something new and was very happy about it!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: LisaLi
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean and fairly new hotel, good location (central) and quiet. Stayed for few nights in january, wasn't fully booked (i assume)... because the sauna and other facilities wasn't occupied the time we stayed there. Sauna for 2/3 persons, with outside shower, men /women divided. Swimmingpool on the rooftop. Rooms are clean, tidy , as all the NH hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, superb location”
Reviews.Author: NessaDublin
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough about this hotel. I was concerned when I booked it that it was cheaper than other 4 star hotels in the area, but on arriving we were so surprised. Location is superb, right in the middle of things yet quiet. Rooms are huge and very modern. No noise from busy Barcelona streets. Lovely rooftop pool and terrace which we didn't use ( it was February!), but was a lovely escape from the city. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: pastaS
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in August for a business trip. The location is perfect, in terms of being in the city centre. Took advice of others and requested a room at the upper floors. Not only are these brand new, clean and spacious, but also you get an incredible view from all windows. In the event that you can not get a upper-level room, I suggest taking a trip to the rooftop. If not for a swim, at least for the spectacular views. Also the room had nice extra touches, such as nh-smints and extra bathroom amenities such as comb and shoe polish. Only thing unfortunate is that the hotel, for some legal reasons, is unable to deliver an iron + board to the room. I therefore had a very crumpled shirt to wear. On the other hand, there are plenty of shopping opps just outside the door, that one can always buy a shirt on the spot. My rate did not include breakfast, which was just fine. When you walk out the main entrance and take a left, there is a lovely cafe/bar about 10 metres down where you can have an excellent service of coffee, pastries and juice. Would definately stay at this nh hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Snic
Reviews.Content: Wow, what can I say! If you want a great hotel in a great location then stay at the NH Calderon. My husband and I stayed for 3 nights from Aug 4th-7th and had a great time. The hotel is very good value 100 euros a night and I would definitely stay again. The rooms are sapcious, very clean and have great ammenities. This hotel also has a pool on the roof which is small but offers fantastic views. 100% recommend it. The hotel is right at the top of La Ramblas and 3 minute walk from Placa de Catalunya. This is a good place to take a tour bus from or the bus back to the airport (3.5 euros). Loads of great restaurants around and all the main sights/beach are fairly close by. The rooms are very quiet and ask for one with a balcony (as most do not have them).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or Hospital”
Reviews.Author: Bubbles01
Reviews.Content: We experienced this hotel during the first long weekend in June of 2006. WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. My partner has been staying at this hotel for close to 10 years and always selects this property for our visits to Barcelona. Four years ago, I joined him and fell in love with Barcelona and this property. The area is awesome and it's location near the Ramblas is fantastic. I am sad to say that this hotel is not worthy of my affection & we were both MAJORLY disappointed & disgusted by the staff, the rooms and the general property. In summary, point by point. 1) pool is crap with no more than 8 or 10 pool beds 2) spa is closed on weekend - despite the hotel being 100% full 3) room was small and filthy 4) staff were rude with unprofessional telephone manners, incapable of eloquently responding to issues 5) not possible to internet in the room - missing necessary cables to connect laptop and when we called down to ask we reached some kind of caveman who was never taught how to communicate on a phone let alone to guests. Shocking to speak to someone who communicates like an ape PLUS did not have any knowledge of computers. 6) rooms are small, using every space - when I was working on my laptop (without internet - needed to check emails from work but could not) and could not open the desk drawer which was unable to be opened completely cuz of the space. 7) We asked for a quiet room and were given a room directly in front of the elevator- front desk not very smart about floor/room layout. 8) Changed rooms and was then given a room without a bathtub - how DARE they charge 155 EUR for a room without a bathtub. Front desk said they were unaware that that room did not have a bathtub (only a shower). 9) Third room has 2 tiny beds together which resembles hospital beds with giant wheels that moved and rolled around anytime you moved - UNBELIEVABLE! 10) On our last night, the wheel of one bed broke off and the bed would tip over if I moved. Could not fix it because it had a broken screw. Did not bother to call maintenance since it was 2AM and doubtful that the hotel actually employed staff to help with these issues since most of the general services were lacking staff. I have digital photos to show proof of the shabby bed conditions. 11) carpets in the halls outside our rooms (and on the 3 floors I visited) were all filthy and not vacuumed during our entire stay. They had completed a renovation phase (with unfinished walls in front of elevators and buttons not functioning etc. etc) and seemed to lack any sense of style to complete the job. 12) We noticed that the room also did not display any fire escape route behind the doors which is quite illegal but not a concern for this property. I also have pictures of this and will forward to the authorities. 13) On the day before our flight, we wanted to check in online for our flight the following day but, as mentioned earlier, we were unable to get internet access in our room so we tried the mini-business centre off the lobby - WHICH ALSO DID NOT HAVE ANY STAFF. There was another guest using a computer for over 30 minutes so we used another computer since there was nobody around to guide us. Five minutes into our task, some front office staff member came shouting into the room HEY HEY HEY .... to get our attention, rather than politely addressing us as guests should be. He proceeded to shout us and tell us that we should NOT be using this computer. So I responded by advising him that there is not staff or signs anywhere informing us - plus the computer was turned on so how were we to know. He continued to be angry so I asked for the manager IMMEDIATELY. But he disappeared and the manger never came so we walked away after 20 minutes of waiting and found ourselves thoroughly disgusted by this point. These were just a few of our experiences, we have many more along with some lovely digital photos to document the poor state of this hotel. WE DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE and I will be sure to share my message with everyone I meet and on every travel forum I can find. Happy travelling everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: tomsak
Reviews.Content: The Calderon is in a great central location for sightseeing and business. I had a renovated room on the 7th floor which was clean and nicely furnished. There is a nice fitness center on the 11th floor as well as an outdoor pool and lounging area with great views. The lobby areas are small but very nice. Breakfast is as good as it gets in Europe. My only complaints were the laminated floors in the rooms which are extremely noisy when walking with shoes (walking in the next room sounded like it was in my own room)and the exorbitant Internet access fees which seems to be the case everywhere in better hotels. The more stars, the more you pay for all the extras. Doesn't seem right.

Reviews.Title: “One of NH's finest !”
Reviews.Author: ip202659
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in late December 2005 and found this to be an excellent hotel. Rate was about 110 Eur for a double room (w/o breakfast). Rooms were very spacious, bright, very well decorated, comfortable, simple but with class. Common areas are vast and comfortable, very important trait in a city such as Barcelona where after a long day strolling (either shopping or sightseeing) you'll want to wind down. Location is very good, right on Rambla Catalunya, about 200 metres from Plaza Catalunya and 100 metres from Passeig de Gracià. This is a genuine 4 star hotel with very good service, just a complaint regarding breakfast which at 17 Euros is very pricey but then again that is NH practice and basically industry practice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: Cres
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Good Bedrooms. Recomend for city break and business.

Reviews.Title: “poor rooms- definately not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: jardines
Reviews.Content: stayed at nh calderon end of august 2005 for 2 nights after cruise. Booked online with alpha rooms who had cheapest rate - £112per night including breakfast. First impressions were good, check in quick and polite staff, we were given room on 2nd floor after previously requesting a room on upper floor, room was dark- tired and not over clean. When asked to be moved to a better room we were told that we had a very cheap rate and that they had nothing else available. On further investigation we realised that the hotel was under some refurbishment as the top half of the building was out of use, except for the rooftop swimming pool. Hotel is in a good position for shops and sightseeing etc and when rooms are refurbished it will be worthy of 4 stars - to sum up - breakfast buffet was very good and roof top pool also good but needs more sunbeds and chairs as i counted only 8 sunbeds which were all taken when we used the pool - did not think we got value for what we paid considering the vast amount of hotel deals in barcelona. Give it a miss until all work is complete -- trip advisor user - brighton sussex uk

Reviews.Title: “good quality hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Esteven
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel several times, and the last time was mid january 2005 (I will return mid July). This hotel is belonging to the NH hotelgroup. The founder of this hotelgroup later on sold his chair and opened the AC Hoteles, with even more eye for detail and guests'needs. The building is from the seventies and was completely refurbished. The NH Gran Hotel Calderon has a private arts collection, which you can see in the corridors and the lobby. The hotel is a good 4* hotel wih all modern ammenities, although some rooms are rather small. Rooms all have private bathroom with great bath products, make-up mirror, hairdryer. Rooms have private safe (electronic), minibar, interactive tv with games and pay tv. Bar: nice, but not a lot of people make use of it, so it's more a quite area to read a book in stead of a cosey bar. Breakfast buffet is just great, with great variety (dietic and normal food, fresh fruit juices, etc...). Eggs: they cook them as you wish. Normally they have apart from the outdour rooftop pool an indoor swiming pool (ground flour - with sauna and gym) but last time I went there they were refurbushing and constructing a SPA on the rooftop near the outdoor pool. Guests, however, were given an alternative: free entrance to a nearby gym. Location is superb: near the Ramblas (the hotel is situated on a shopping street - Rambla de Catalunya - which is the prolongation of Las Ramblas), near major shopping areas: El Corte Inglés, Portal del Angel and Passeig de Gracià (more luxurious shooping) are just arround the corner. Eating out: on the corner a great tapabar, worldfamous in Barcelona: Ciudad Condal!!!! Opposite a decent restaurant: La Tramoia. In the neighbourhoud: Citrus / Jean Luc Figueras - 2 Michelin stars/ Tragaluz, El japonés... The location is also superb for sightseeing: just around the corner: las ramblas, gaudi-monuments such as La Pedrera and Casa Battló, Plaza de Cataluyna where you can take the BUS TURISTIC (hop on, hop off)... Public transport: metro and train and busses: Plaza de Catalunya (less than 100m). Also on the plaza de Catalunya you can take the AEROBUS to the airport for 3.50 euros. Great value, because has very few stops (max 3) and is specially designed for passangers with luggage. This hotel can be recommended both for business as for leisure! Enjoy your stay! I certainly did and that's why I always return.
